document.docAuthor: Sánchez-García, José Antonio, Wharton, Robert Alan, Romero-Napoles, Jesús, Figueroa, José Isaac, López-Martínez, Víctor, Martínez, Ana Mabel, Pérez-Pacheco, Rafael & Pineda, Samuel
document.docTitle: Blacus (Ganychorus) basitarsis Sanchez et Wharton, NEW SPECIES
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of Blacus Nees (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Blacinae) from Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of Blacus Nees (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Blacinae) from Mexico

heading.emphasis:
Blacus (Ganychorus) basitarsis Sánchez et Wharton
,
NEW SPECIES

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. MALE. Body length: 2.47–3.05 mm . Color: dark brown; palpi, mandible and pedicel yellowish; scape, tegula and legs (except hind tibia that are dark brown) yellowish brown; parastigma clear brown; pterostigma mostly brown with a little whitish at the ends.

Head: ovoid; vertex not convex; 21 antennal segments, third segment 1.33–1.57 X longer than fourth, length of third, fourth and penultimate antennal segment 5.00– 5.50 , 3.50 –4.00 and 1.20–1.25 X their width, respectively; last antennal segment without fusion of two segments; eye length 1.05–1.16 X longer than temple; maximum width of head 1.76–2.09 X its minimum width (dorsal view); frontal suture superficial; malar suture present; malar space 1.33–1.75 X as long as basal width of mandible; area in front of occipital carina crenulate; frons and vertex with some setae; face with some setae. Mesosoma: mesosoma length 1.31– 1.44 X its height; pronotum reticulate rugose; posterior margin of epicnemial carina crenulate; epicnemial area superficially microstriate; precoxal sulcus rugose; metapleural flange medium size and truncated; notauli narrow, anteriorly crenulate and posteriorly rugose; mesoscutal lobes smooth, slightly convex; scutellum largely smooth with some wrinkles, its lateral carina distinct, slightly projecting apically; propodeal tubercles absent; propodeum rugose but with distinct median and lateral carinae, posterior surface reticulo-rugose. Wings: forewing with parastigma large; r inclivous; 3 RS weakly curved basally; 1 CUa 0.48–0.62 X as long as 1 CUb; r 0.19 X as long as 3 RS; 3 RS 3.70 X as long as 2 RS; first discal cell more or less truncated anteriorly; forewing length 2.40–3.21 mm ; hind wing with vein cu-a present. Legs: hind coxa dorsally rugose; length of femur, tibia and basitarsus of hind leg 8.09–8.80 , 12.86–15.14 , and 11.00– 11.50 X their width, respectively; arolia small. Metasoma: Length of first tergite 2.27–2.78 X its apical width, superficially striate-rugose, dorsal carinae distinct over basal two-fifths, spiracle slightly projecting. Genitalia: aedeagus in form of bottle, wider in its medial part and pointed, with a medial deep channel; gonoforceps more or less pointed with some setae distributed of the medial part at the apex; digitus with six teeth; cuspis with some spines; lamina volsellaris with three setae.

FEMALE. Similar to male, except fore and middle legs have large, black bristles in tarsal claws; tarsal claw of hind leg with small, brown bristles; 20 antennal segments; ovipositor sheath 0.18–0.20 X longer than forewing length.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Blacus basitarsis
sp. nov.
a. male habitus; b. male: anterior view of head; c. male: dorsal view of head; d. female: dorsal view of mesosoma; e. male: lateral view of mesosoma; f. male wings; g. male: dorsal view of propodeum and first tergite; h. female: ovipositor; i. male genitalia.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The specific name
basitarsis
was chosen because this species has a very long hind basitarsus. Distribution records. MEXICO (Chiapas, Estado de México , Guanajuato, Guerrero, Michoacán, Morelos, Oaxaca, Puebla and Tamaulipas).

Comments. This species is near
B. collaris (Ashmead)
and
B. epitolus Achterberg
, and runs to the couplet containing these two species in the key to New World species of
Blacus ( Ganychorus )
in
Achterberg ( 1988 : 90–92 )
; and is also near to
B. julianae Sánchez & Figueroa
sp. nov.
The four species are distingued by the following modified key:

11 Eye length in dorsal view approx. 1.00– 1.16 X temple length; ovipositor sheath 0.16–0.56 X forewing length. 12 - Eye length in dorsal view approx. 1.40–1.60 X temple length; ovipositor sheath 0.12–0.14 X forewing length ....

..............................................................................................................
Blacus ( Ganychorus ) epitolus Achterberg
12 ( 11 ) Ovipositor sheath 0.16–0.20 X forewing length; hind tibia length 9.2–15.14 X its maximum width................... 13 - Ovipositor sheath 0.36–0.56 X forewing length; hind tibia length 16.00X its maximum width..............................

.................................................................................................................... Blacus
( Ganychorus ) julianae
sp. nov.
13 ( 12 ) Length first tergite 2.27–2.78 X its apical width; hind basitarsus length 11.00– 11.50 X its width; parastigma of

male enlarged
........................................................................................... Blacus
( Ganychorus ) basitarsis
sp. nov.
- Length of first tergite 1.70 –2.00X its apical width; hind basitarsus length 9.00X its width; parastigma of male

The male genitalia of
B. basitarsis
is similar to
B. ruficornis
and
B. julianae
, however in
B. julianae
the apical portion of the aedeagus is wider than the other two species; also in
B. julianae
the lamina volsellaris has six setae while in
B. ruficornis
and
B. basitarsis
there are only three setae.
